data.text: What kind of anxious, is it nervousness, anxiety or in between? I typically have nervousness about forgetting stuff. Basically, your head is gearing up to the unknown, which is good. I make check list to reduce forgetting equipment and to-do stuff. You can also look at the rout and vision what can go wrong and how to mitigate and deal with it. Try to see if it is something(s) specific that gives you that feeling. Lastly, the more you try the long tours, the more you‚Äôll feel comfortable before. Enjoy

data.text: I get on my bike and ride it out. The doubt inside your mind is pre-programmed to keep you safe, it‚Äôs a left over from an archaic species that preceded humans. Recognize it as healthy and then jump that hurdle by knowing that you‚Äôre well-trained and well prepared.

data.author: Barry Van Meter

data.text: discord is just a space. Imagine a Facebook group but far more detailed. It will have text chats and voice chats. You can dedicate them to different things. Typically they are good at bringing communities together. I am in a few, one for a group of friends that outgrew at messenger group chat. Others for people who play ttrpgs etc. I have a small one because of my other social media work. I'm sure there are bike packing ones out there.
data.author: Sufyan Saleem

data.text: we have channels in a discord dedicated to different topics, posting photos, organised social events etc.. people are basically migrating to that over Facebook groups.
data.author: Sufyan Saleem

data.text: given your yt channel it might be worth making for those people to interact with you, build community etc..
data.author: Sufyan Saleem

data.text: Lay out all your gear. Check it twice. Pack. Check your route/ maps, at least for a first day plan. Roll on.

data.author: Barry Van Meter

data.text: I try and list out the things that cause me anxiety/ fear that I can have some control over which is my gear, knowledge and my fitness. Usually the anxiety for me on trips, is it‚Äôs night and I‚Äôm not sure I have enough CO2 cartridges, tire sealant, or something to boot a tireÔøºÔøº, or the charge running low in my headlamp, etc, etc‚Ä¶. Running through my gear checklist making sure it‚Äôs thought out and making sure I‚Äôm familiar how do use everything on it how tends calm a lot of those fears. In the past I have been concerned about my skills as a mechanic or being able to make a fix when I‚Äôm in the middle of nowhereÔøºÔøº. I‚Äôve spent time working on that stuff before heading out on trips, gives me the confidence that I‚Äôm at least familiar with how to fix an issue if it comes up and tams down the anxiety that I haven‚Äôt addressed at all I‚Äôm out on the bike. It‚Äôs something that‚Äôs works for meÔøº. Also echoing what Lawrence said above. As long you‚Äôve got cell, cc cash almost no problem you can‚Äôt get out of. Bourbon helps too.

data.text: Movement/exercise or meditation can help with anxiety. Acceptance of the fact that anxiety is normal and natural in certain situations can also help reduce anxiety. Personally, I just accept that I‚Äôve done what I can and that when things come up, I‚Äôll deal with them the best I can.
